name: Lahmajoun
description: A thin, crispy flatbread topped with a spicy mixture of minced meat, tomatoes, bell peppers, and herbs.
steps: Prepare the dough from flour, yeast, warm water, and salt, and let it rise until doubled in size.
Mix finely ground lamb or beef with finely diced tomatoes, bell peppers, onion, parsley, and spices.
Roll the dough into very thin circles, spread the meat mixture thinly on top.
Bake in a very hot oven for about 5 minutes until the edges are crisp and the topping is cooked.
Serve hot with a squeeze of lemon and fresh parsley.
tips: Ensure the dough is rolled out very thin to achieve a crispy texture.
Do not overload the dough with the topping to keep the lahmajoun crispy.
Preheat the oven with a pizza stone or baking sheet inside to an extremely high temperature before baking.
